snippet: Before the change, the company’s policy required some matters to be settled through binding arbitration.
abstract: Hyundai's warranty policy stipulates some disputes be settled through binding arbitration unless owner notifies company within 90 days of purchasing vehicle that they wish to opt out of arrangement; consumer advocates warn that failing to opt out could disqualify owners from joining class-action suits or make it harder to collect refund if vehicle is determined to be a lemon.
lead_paragraph: Before the change, the company’s policy required some matters to be settled through binding arbitration.

headline.main: Hyundai Reverses Policy on Settling Warranty Disputes
headline.print_headline: Warranty Clause Limits Hyundai Owner Rights
